chapter.keywords: online king james holy bible, king james bible, bible todo list, words of Jesus, bible index, the authorised version, KJV, KJB, KJAV, AV

items.text: Hear ye the word which the LORD speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:
items.plainText: Hear ye the word which the LORD speaketh unto you, O house of Israel:

items.text: Thus saith the LORD, Learn not the way of the heathen, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the heathen are dismayed at them.
items.plainText: Thus saith the LORD, Learn not the way of the heathen, and be not dismayed at the signs of heaven; for the heathen are dismayed at them.

items.text: For the customs of the people are vain: for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman, with the axe.
items.plainText: For the customs of the people are vain: for one cutteth a tree out of the forest, the work of the hands of the workman, with the axe.

items.text: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.
items.plainText: They deck it with silver and with gold; they fasten it with nails and with hammers, that it move not.

items.text: They are upright as the palm tree, but speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither also is it in them to do good.
items.plainText: They are upright as the palm tree, but speak not: they must needs be borne, because they cannot go. Be not afraid of them; for they cannot do evil, neither also is it in them to do good.

items.text: Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O LORD; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.
items.plainText: Forasmuch as there is none like unto thee, O LORD; thou art great, and thy name is great in might.

items.text: Who would not fear thee, O King of nations? for to thee doth it appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is none like unto thee.
items.plainText: Who would not fear thee, O King of nations? for to thee doth it appertain: forasmuch as among all the wise men of the nations, and in all their kingdoms, there is none like unto thee.

items.text: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.
items.plainText: But they are altogether brutish and foolish: the stock is a doctrine of vanities.

items.text: Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the workman, and of the hands of the founder: blue and purple is their clothing: they are all the work of cunning men.
items.plainText: Silver spread into plates is brought from Tarshish, and gold from Uphaz, the work of the workman, and of the hands of the founder: blue and purple is their clothing: they are all the work of cunning men.

items.text: But the LORD is the true God, he is the living God, and an everlasting king: at his wrath the earth shall tremble, and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.
items.plainText: But the LORD is the true God, he is the living God, and an everlasting king: at his wrath the earth shall tremble, and the nations shall not be able to abide his indignation.

items.text: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, even they shall perish from the earth, and from under these heavens.
items.plainText: Thus shall ye say unto them, The gods that have not made the heavens and the earth, even they shall perish from the earth, and from under these heavens.

items.text: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.
items.plainText: He hath made the earth by his power, he hath established the world by his wisdom, and hath stretched out the heavens by his discretion.

items.text: When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.
items.plainText: When he uttereth his voice, there is a multitude of waters in the heavens, and he causeth the vapours to ascend from the ends of the earth; he maketh lightnings with rain, and bringeth forth the wind out of his treasures.

items.text: Every man is brutish in his knowledge: every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.
items.plainText: Every man is brutish in his knowledge: every founder is confounded by the graven image: for his molten image is falsehood, and there is no breath in them.

items.text: They are vanity, and the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.
items.plainText: They are vanity, and the work of errors: in the time of their visitation they shall perish.

items.text: The portion of Jacob is not like them: for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: The LORD of hosts is his name.
items.plainText: The portion of Jacob is not like them: for he is the former of all things; and Israel is the rod of his inheritance: The LORD of hosts is his name.

items.text: Gather up thy wares out of the land, O inhabitant of the fortress.
items.plainText: Gather up thy wares out of the land, O inhabitant of the fortress.

items.text: For thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once, and will distress them, that they may find it so.
items.plainText: For thus saith the LORD, Behold, I will sling out the inhabitants of the land at this once, and will distress them, that they may find it so.

items.text: Woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is a grief, and I must bear it.
items.plainText: Woe is me for my hurt! my wound is grievous: but I said, Truly this is a grief, and I must bear it.

items.text: My tabernacle is spoiled, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth of me, and they are not: there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.
items.plainText: My tabernacle is spoiled, and all my cords are broken: my children are gone forth of me, and they are not: there is none to stretch forth my tent any more, and to set up my curtains.

items.text: For the pastors are become brutish, and have not sought the LORD: therefore they shall not prosper, and all their flocks shall be scattered.
items.plainText: For the pastors are become brutish, and have not sought the LORD: therefore they shall not prosper, and all their flocks shall be scattered.

items.text: Behold, the noise of the bruit is come, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, and a den of dragons.
items.plainText: Behold, the noise of the bruit is come, and a great commotion out of the north country, to make the cities of Judah desolate, and a den of dragons.

items.text: O LORD, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.
items.plainText: O LORD, I know that the way of man is not in himself: it is not in man that walketh to direct his steps.

items.text: O LORD, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.
items.plainText: O LORD, correct me, but with judgment; not in thine anger, lest thou bring me to nothing.

items.text: Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name: for they have eaten up Jacob, and devoured him, and consumed him, and have made his habitation desolate.
items.plainText: Pour out thy fury upon the heathen that know thee not, and upon the families that call not on thy name: for they have eaten up Jacob, and devoured him, and consumed him, and have made his habitation desolate.
